about.description: Hey! I am a senior in Aeronautical and Astronautical Engineering, graduating in December 2024. My journey through aerospace engineering and undergraduate research ignited a passion for Autonomy and Controls, driven by my early interest in programming for engineering projects. Hands-on experiences in manufacturing and design, coupled with learning electrical hardware and microcontrollers, led me to pursue a minor in Electrical Engineering Technology at Purdue University. Presenting at a prestigious conference and winning an award for my research reinforced my commitment to designing and implementing advanced control systems. My engineering education has taught me the importance of engineering, creating solutions for real-world problems. I am excited to contribute and learn from leading engineering companies as a controls/robotics engineer.

projects.name: College Based Task Management System with Rails
projects.description: A task management system for college students to manage their assignments, projects and exams. Is being built using Ruby on Rails and AWS

projects.name: This Website (Angular Portfolio)
projects.description: The website is built using Angular and styled with Tailwind CSS to showcase off my experiences, skills and projects while giving me a learning experience of AngularJS

experiences.company: Flight Dynamics and Control Lab Research

experiences.description: I assist with student recruitment for the college of engineering at Purdue by interacting with prospective students and their families, both in-person and virtually. I provide insight into Purdue Engineering by sharing personal expereinces and knowledge gained from undergraudate experiences that would help the students identify if Purdue is the right fit fot them. Additionally, I often co-present at engineering information sessions that are presented everyday for students and families. Furthermore, I assist in the development of resources and marketing to improve guest experience as they navigate the resources provide by the Office of Future Engineers.

I serve as the first point of contact for students living in university dorms to assist with any issues with housing such lost keys, or roommate issues, and in getting their pacakges, along with helping them check-in and out of the dorms. During the summer terms, I additionally perform dorm safety checks and assist with hosting summer conferences.

I assisted students in understanding the concepts and approaching HWs for AAE 364, a Control Systems Analysis course. I hold help sessions, verify/create HW solutions, grade regrade requests, and proctor exams.

I trained at the design center to learn to do computer aided manufacturing (CAM) and to learn to use a CNC and manual machines. As a Peer Mentor, I assisted students for personal projects and Purdue design teams/student organizations with designing (CAD/CAM) and manufacturing their parts. I teach them how to use CNC and manual machines so they can manfucature their own parts.

I assisted students in understanding the fundamentals of coding and data analysis using Excel, Python, and MATLAB. I attended class sessions twice a week to assist students as they completed their team HWs and class projects, assisted in grading assignments, and gave reviews on exams and HWs.

educations.degree: Bachelor of Science in Aeronautical and Astronautical Engineering
educations.description: Specializing in Autonomy and Controls with a Minor in Electrical Engineering Technology
